message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.DS 

This paper focuses on analyzing and understanding the growth dynamics of information cascades in social networks, which falls under the category of social network analysis. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also uses Granger causality and vector autoregression models to forecast the occurrence of events in the cascade lifecycle, which falls under the category of time series analysis and forecasting, making cs.SD (Systems and Control) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper studies the effect of network topology on the growth dynamics, which falls under the category of network science, making cs.SOC (Social and Economic Networks) a likely sub-category. The paper also uses measures such as clustering coefficient and PageRank, which are commonly used in information retrieval and web search algorithms, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with a large dataset and uses statistical methods to analyze the data, which falls under the category of data science, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category.
